image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Amid growing pressure from state premiers, Labor's federal leaders have suspended its links to the construction division of the CFMEU, which has been engulfed in scandals in recent days.

title.children: Federal Labor bans donations, cuts ties with scandal-engulfed CFMEU

image.altText: Construction site

props.synopsis: The lure of long-term employment on major construction sites has been one major factor in why home building has become so expensive.

title.children: Has the CFMEU made home building more expensive? Yes, but not how you think

image.altText: A generic photo of a hotel worker

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate continues to edge higher, despite the creation of about 50,000, mostly full-time, jobs last month.

title.children: Unemployment edges up despite more than 50,000 extra jobs amid rapid population growth

image.altText: JD Vance smiles as he delivers a speech on stage, his right hand on his chest

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's pick for vice president, JD Vance, addresses the Republican National Convention as US President Joe Biden tests positive for COVID-19. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's VP pick JD Vance addresses Republican convention, Biden catches COVID

image.altText: A man stands in a forest on a sunny day, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest super fund is investing money from its 'Socially Aware' option in the coal, oil and gas industries, despite excluding shares and corporate bonds of companies with fossil fuel reserves.

title.children: AustralianSuper's ethical option is investing in coal, oil and gas industries

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Officials and victims' loved ones gather near Amsterdam to mark the 10-year anniversary of MH17 being shot down, as Australian Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus tells the crowd the tragedy deepened the bonds between his country and the Netherlands.

title.children: 'I haven't lost hope': Memorial service held near Amsterdam to mark 10-year anniversary of MH17 disaster

image.altText: Three upset fans hold up their invalid tickets.

props.synopsis: A number of footy fans found themselves locked out of the State of Origin decider on Wednesday night, after purchasing tickets through unauthorised sellers.

title.children: Ticket scalping a 'kick in the guts' for fans locked out of Origin decider

image.altText: NSW Police

props.synopsis: The senior NSW police officer was charged late last year with driving under the influence of alcohol and high-range drink-driving, nearly six months after the incident.

title.children: Sydney detective charged with drink-driving after crashing police car engaged in serious misconduct, watchdog finds

image.altText: An aerial view of a hydropower dam among hills.

props.synopsis: Laos built about 80 hydropower dams on the Mekong River and its tributaries with the goal of becoming South-East Asia's "battery". But the revenue from the infrastructure is yet to flow through and the debt repayments are mounting up.

title.children: Laos is struggling to repay billions owed to China. What now?

image.altText: Volleyballs generic

props.synopsis: The board of Volleyball Australia has issued an apology to former players who suffered through "an environment of fear," coercive control, physical and psychological abuse.

title.children: Volleyball Australia apologises to former players for physical and psychological abuse

image.altText: A composite image of James Rose and Stephen Gale.

props.synopsis: Stephen Gale, 56, and cameraman James Rose, 30, were killed after two Viper S-211 Marchetti planes crashed mid-air in November last year, during a formation flight.

title.children: Pilots did not discuss manoeuvre before fatal mid-air crash in Melbourne, ATSB finds

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Unemployment has risen slightly to 4.1 per cent in June, up from 4 per cent the previous month. Follow live.

title.children: Unemployment up slightly to 4.1pc in June

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rates to hold steady at next RBA meeting: BDO Economics
What does the job data mean for inflation (and rates)?
Unpacking the rise in the unemployment rate in June

image.altText: NSW MP Ron Hoenig looking serious while outside with trees behind him with Premier Chris Minns to left of image

props.synopsis: Local Government Minister Ron Hoenig has advised Mayor Ned Mannoun that Liverpool Council has a week to prove why it should not be suspended, after an investigation found "widespread and serious concerns about dysfunction" within the council.

title.children: Western Sydney council given seven days to prove it should not be suspended after report

image.altText: A composite of headshots of both men speaking at microphones.

props.synopsis: After once describing Donald Trump as "nuts" and a "traitor to the West", former prime minister Kevin Rudd has changed his tune.

title.children: Why men who once called Trump 'nuts' and 'America's Hitler' are now supporting him

image.altText: A man in a suit with a bandaged ear

props.synopsis: The attempt on Donald Trump's life has strengthened Joe Biden's position when it comes to holding onto his party's presidential nomination. It has also weakened his chances of winning another four years in the White House as Republican voters are now hyper-motivated. But a Trump victory is not pre-ordained.

title.children: An energy gap has emerged in the US election race

image.altText: A police trooper wearing a hat stands in silhouette in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: The gunman who tried to assassinate Donald Trump fired from a rooftop that neither the US Secret Service or local police had secured.

title.children: Rooftop used by Trump shooter wasn't secured by either Secret Service or local police, officials say

image.altText: A woman holding a flame torch hands it to a man

props.synopsis: Modern Olympians might not compete naked or offer blood tributes to the gods. But there are a number of rituals you'll see at this year's Games that carry ancient religious roots.

title.children: We don't sacrifice animals at the Olympics anymore, but plenty of other ancient traditions remain

image.altText: Akii Ngo on the ground next to their wheelchair.

props.synopsis: A disability advocate has urged the aviation industry to lift accessibility standards after Jetstar apologised to the passenger for an incident which caused them to fall out of a wheelchair.

title.children: Jetstar apologises to wheelchair user over 'distressing' airport incident

image.altText: A bespectacled woman and her 10yo daughter look solemnly at photos of a boy.

props.synopsis: Joey's family had just moved into their new rental home and were waiting for removalists to deliver their furniture, but when they arrived he had disappeared.

title.children: Joey Vines drowned quietly in a neighbour's pool. Years later, his family is finally smiling again

image.altText: A crystal blue beach with a boat by the beach.

props.synopsis: Australians can now enjoy visa-free travel for up to 60 days in Thailand as the country looks to boost tourism.

title.children: Thailand expands visa free-travel for 93 countries, including Australia

image.altText: Two drawers full of hundreds of loose bird eggs.

props.synopsis: Federal environmental officers say the Hobart man is alleged to have traded with someone in Europe and amassed a collection of more than 3,000 eggs, including many native Australian birds.

title.children: Officers swoop on man with more than 3,000 bird eggs, including from one of Australia's rarest birds

image.altText: Composite photo of two men and one woman.

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 Palestinian refugees have made their way to Australia since the war in Gaza began in October last year. While relieved to have made it out, many are deeply pained by the fact they are now safe while many of their friends and family are not.

title.children: Money bought Amer's family freedom and a new life. It has not bought them peace

image.altText: Swimming champion and World War 1 hero, Cecil Healy

props.synopsis: Australian Olympian Cecil Healy was the epitome of fair play, though his life was cut short in the most unfair way imaginable in the killing fields of World War I. He remains Australia's only Olympic gold medallist to be killed in action. Now, he has been honoured by the Australian Olympic Committee.

title.children: The Australian Olympian who redefined sportsmanship and became a symbol of the futility of war

image.altText: Concept art of a skyscraper in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The City of Sydney is considering development plans from construction giants Dexus and Lendlease for two towers in the city's CBD that, if built, would be the city's tallest buildings.

title.children: Sydney skyline could reach new heights with plans for two 'super tall' towers

image.altText: A melee breaks out on the sideline of a rugby league state of origin match, with players and staff pushing

props.synopsis: NSW's Haumole Olakau'atu and Cameron Murray are facing two-match suspensions following the Blues' State of Origin series-deciding victory.

title.children: Two Blues handed suspensions over Origin fight as Maroons stars escape with fines

image.altText: A graphic of beers held before the facade of Cascade Brewery.

props.synopsis: Cascade Brewery was started by a swindler 200 years ago. It's now Australia's oldest brewery and workers are reflecting on its colourful history, including 15-minute beer breaks for workers and the bushfire that nearly ended it all.

title.children: 'There are hundreds of stories you could tell about the place': Australia's oldest brewery turns 200

image.altText: Man standing in front of river with leaves

props.synopsis: Faced with successive natural disasters, lifelong farmers are choosing to leave Queensland's 'salad bowl'. It has community leaders worried.

title.children: Faced with successive natural disasters, lifelong farmers are leaving this 'salad bowl'

image.altText: A statue of a bull charging sits on a paved city street

props.synopsis: Financial markets are pricing in a victory for Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, with further all-time highs on the US stock market expected under a Trump presidency.

title.children: Who will be the next US president? The financial markets have a bet placed firmly on one candidate

image.altText: police officers stand in front of Eiffel tower

props.synopsis: Three separate incidents have struck Paris less than 10 days before the start of the Olympic Games, heightening security fears as France gears into a high state of alert.

title.children: Paris on high alert as three separate incidents strike city less than 10 days before Games

image.altText: A man celebrates winning a State of Origin match

props.synopsis: The Blues passed the ultimate test of their Origin mettle to win the decider at Lang Park and their reward is a place in New South Wales folklore.

title.children: How a blood-soaked try and unbreakable belief carried New South Wales to State of Origin glory

image.altText: A composite image of Jerry Seinfeld, Emma Stone, Shōgun and an emmy statue

props.synopsis: Shōgun and The Bear have dominated today's Emmy nominations but others didn't fare as well. Let's unpack the snubs and surprises lurking lower down the list.

title.children: Stop encouraging Jerry Seinfeld: Some serious analysis of the 2024 Emmy nominee snubs and surprises

image.altText: A computer graphic of Earth with the word Universal in large lettering before it

props.synopsis: Film studio logos are as well-known as our favourite movie actors, but are they finally losing their prominence due to the rise of streaming?

title.children: The story behind Hollywood's all-powerful studio logos as Netflix, streaming services force change

image.altText: A blond man in a superhero outfit holds his arms out as confetti rains down

props.synopsis: Superhero satire The Boys has been brutally sending up late stage capitalism for half a decade but the latest season might hit too close to home.

title.children: Why this megalomaniac anti-superhero has caused so much division among its fanbase

image.altText: Queen Camilla wearing a jewel crown and jewel necklace in a white dress

props.synopsis: The formal start of the UK's parliamentary year happened to fall on Queen Camilla's 77th birthday.

title.children: Queen Camilla celebrates 77th birthday wearing iconic 1,333-diamond-crown at opening of UK parliament

image.altText: A male house sparrow, with brown and black markings around its face, sits on a tin fence.

props.synopsis: Sparrows are often considered pests, but a new study suggests lead levels in the birds' blood could indicate if children in mining towns have been exposed to high levels of the poisonous chemical.

title.children: Many Australian towns are contaminated by lead, but sparrows can predict if kids have lead poisoning
